thread.title: Senator Tom Cotton: Obama “Undermined” Efforts To Get Tough on Putin
thread.title_full: Senator Tom Cotton: Obama “Undermined” Efforts To Get Tough on Putin

author: Nickarama
title: Senator Tom Cotton: Obama “Undermined” Efforts To Get Tough on Putin
text:
06:11pm January 2, 2017   
President Obama is taking Vladimir Putin to the woodshed now, expelling diplomats and employing sanctions against Russia for alleged hacking. 
But he’s late to the game in reacting, according to Republican Senator Tom Cotton. 
From Washington Examiner: 
He said Obama had actively “undermined” earlier legislative efforts by Congress to confront Russia. 
“I wish they hadn’t gone to such extents to undermine efforts to get tough on Russia,” Cotton, a member of the Senate Select Committee on Intelligence, said during an appearance on “Fox News Sunday.” He said the administration lobbied lawmakers against such legislative efforts in the past, claiming that the legislation would hurt the State Department’s diplomatic efforts with Russia. 
Despite allegations of Russian hacking prior to the DNC and John Podesta, most notably of the White House and the State Department, Obama laid back, did nothing and was ‘flexible’. 
Cotton believes that Obama and the Democrats were just using the issue of the DNC and the Podesta leak to cloud the fact that Hillary lost. 
As Cotton noted, she lost because she was a failed candidate. The alleged hacking had no effect on the actual vote. 
But if Obama keeps beating the drum of ‘Russian hacking’, he can help people believe that Hillary didn’t really lose, and that Trump’s win was illegitimate. 
Sounds like he’s right on target with that assessment! LIKE this article?
